title: What exactly is Automation Testing?
description: Automated Test is a software-based testing method that uses specially designed automated tools for...
body_html:
Automated Test is a software-based testing method that uses specially designed automated tools for testing that perform a test case set. In contrast Manual Testing is carried out by a human being sitting front of a computer and carefully performing the test procedures.

The software for automation testing can incorporate test data into System Under Test. System Under Test, compare the expected and actual results, and create thorough reports on tests. Software Test Automation demands considerable expenditure of resources and money.

Each of the development cycles require the execution of the same test routine repeatedly. Utilizing a test automation tool can be recorded this test sequence and replay it whenever needed. After the test suite is automated, no human involvement is needed. This improves the efficiency on Test Automation. The purpose of automation is to decrease the number of test scenarios that need to be manually run and not remove manual testing entirely. You can check out the complete syllabus and curriculum absolutely for free from any Automation Course page.

What's the point of Test Automation?

Testing Automation will be the most effective method to improve the efficiency testing coverage, test coverage and speed of execution when it comes to software testing. Testing software automated is crucial because of several reasons.
Manual testing of every workflow and all fields, in every negative scenario, can be costly and time-consuming.

It can be difficult to check for multilingual sites by hand
Software testing automation is not dependent on human involvement. Test automation can be run in a completely unsupervised manner (overnight)
Test Automation speeds up the speed at which tests are executed
Automation aids in increasing Test Coverage
Manual Testing can become tedious and therefore prone to errors.

Which Test Cases should we automate?

Test cases that are automated are selected according to the following criteria to boost the ROI of automation.

High Risk Test cases for Business Criticality
Test cases are executed repeatedly
Test Cases that are extremely complex or complicated to execute manually
Test Cases that take a long time to complete
The following types of test cases is not suitable to be automated:
Test Cases that have been newly created and not manually executed at least at least
Test Cases in which the requirements change frequently
Test cases that are carried out on an as-needed basis.
Automated Testing Method:

The steps that follow are followed in an Automation Process

  • First Step) Test Tool Selection
  • Step 2.) Define scope of Automation
  • Step 3.) Planning, Design and Development
  • Step 4.) Test Execution
  • five) Maintenance

Test Automation Process
Selecting the test tool
The selection of the Test Tool is mostly based on the technology that the Application Under Test is built on. For example, QTP does not support Informatica. This means that QTP is not suitable to test Informatica Applications. It's an excellent idea to run A Proof of Concept tool on AUT.

Define the scope of automation

The scope of automation covers the scope that is part of the Application Under Test which will be made automated. The following points can help you determine the what is the scope of automation:

  • The essential aspects to the success of a business
  • Scenarios that contain an abundance of information
  • Common functions across different applications
  • Technical feasibility
  • The amount to which components of business are reused
  • The complex of tests
  • Ability to utilize the same test case for cross-browser testing
  • Design, Planning, Design, and Development

In this stage you develop an Automation strategy and plan that includes the following information:
Tools for automation chosen
Framework design and the features it offers
Out-of-Scope as well as In-Scope elements of automation
Automation testing and preparation of testbeds
Timeline and Schedule of scripting and execution
Deliverables from Automation Testing
Test Execution
Automation scripts are run during this stage. The scripts must input test data prior to being activated. Once they are executed, they generate thorough test reports.
Execution can be done through the automation tool by itself or by using an application like the Test Management tool which will activate this automation software.
Examples: Quality center can be described as one of Test Management tool, which is then invoked by QTP for the execution of automated scripts. The scripts are executed on the same machine or several machines. The execution could be performed in the evening, in order to cut down on time.
Test Automation Maintenance Method
Test Automation Maintenance Method is an automated testing process that is used to determine whether the latest features included in the software work or not. Maintenance for automation testing occurs whenever automated scripts that are new are created and require to be monitored and maintained to increase the efficiency of automation scripts in each release cycle.
